resources.string: While the consequences may be severe, at this point they may be unavoidable if safe driving needs to be ensured. The best thing would likely be to preemptively accomodate for the situation, while keeping the phone turned off.
This would appear to be the best response, since it is rooted in the belief that attention must not be diverted from driving in any possible way.
While the response is correct given the situation, the real error lies in not having turnt the phone off before starting the car.
While driving, you receive a phone call, and you are currently expecting an important call from your boss. How do you respond?
1) Considering the consequences of not answering an important call, you decide there is no choice but to answer
2) Realizing the error in not muting the phone before starting the car, ignore the phone call and make a mental note for next time
3) Although the situation is distracting, you ignore the call as best as possible and try to concentrate on driving
4) You decide to answer, thinking that as long as you keep your eyes on the road, you can still drive safely
